Then I go to /etc/ and put in fstab dev/sda1 and it gives me command not found.  fstab by itself also gives me command not found.  If I dir the directly there is a file in there called fstab
oh, god damn it.
ok...first, make sure you can read/write the partition. Make a folder in your home folder (mkdir /home/username/windowxp
then mount the partition there (sudo mount -t ntfs /dev/sda1 /home/username/windowsxp)
if it works you should see your windowsxp in that folder in your home dir
once you are sure it works, just add the following line to /etc/fstab (sudo nano /etc/fstab)...
the line looks like this....../dev/sda1  /home/username/windowsxp ntfs rw,user,noauto 0  0
if the mount command doesn't work let me know

Oh, nvm, I see what I did wrong
it mounted.  I can access the partition w/ places and by terminal.  I'm trying to add that line w/ nano.  Does it matter where I put it?  And, how do I save inside of nano?
you save with Ctrl-X and then follow the prompts to save. The line should go at the end of the fstab file
fyi....the mount command is for one off mounts. If you put the line into /etc/fstab it will automatically mount every time the computer boots
